duties_responsibilities.duty: Conduct short-range planning and scheduling of operational processes to ensure overall job readiness and minimize safety exposures.

Assist in providing reliable support to operations supervision by planning and scheduling activities, managing the work queue, staffing, equipment, materials, tools, permits, and work package instructions.
Develop a firm two-week plan of assigned operations center activities and a one-month projection of anticipated future activities.
Coordinate work request activities and perform pre-construction work request assessments to facilitate optimal resource utilization.
Ensure UG Utility locates, switching/hold offs, and manage time and priorities while providing support to supervision in establishing work commitment dates.

Reflect lines employees crewing and vehicle assignments, utilizing CLICK, and participating in interactions with internal/external customers on inquiries concerning construction and maintenance activities.
Physically visit jobs to determine job readiness state, utilize the job readiness checklist, identify and apply safe work practices, and adhere to motor vehicle safety regulations.
Assist during emergencies and storm-related activities and travel to off-site locations, training facilities, and customer sites when required.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Engineering Technology or related discipline (or equivalent work experience)
